qas.question: what is one reason that caused the island to become less used?

answers.text: the opening of the Suez Canal

qas.question: By who was the sailing ships occupied?
Who used the islands as a base in the Northern Atlantic?

plausible_answers.text: opening of the Suez Canal in 1869, together with the gradual move from sailing ships to coal-fired steam ships

qas.question: What decreased isolation in the islands?
When was the East Asia canal opened?

context: The islands were occupied by <b1_0>a garrison of British Marines<b1_0/> and a civilian population was gradually built up. <b2_0>Whalers<b2_0/> also set up on the islands as a base for operations in the Southern Atlantic. However, <a0_0>the <b4_0>opening of the <b3_0>Suez Canal<b3_0/><a0_0/> in <b5_0>1869<b5_0/>, together with the gradual move from sailing ships to coal-fired steam ships<b4_0/>, increased the isolation of the islands, as they were no longer needed as a stopping port or for shelter for journeys from Europe to East Asia.
